intro: Oreodendron biflorum, commonly known as the two-flowered oreodendron, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in late summer. Its leaves are leathery and arranged in whorls, and it thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. Oreodendron biflorum is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to high-altitude environments.
